actions.in_committee: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston with an amendment in the nature of a substitute. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 706.
Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.
For Previous Action See H.R.3227.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
By Senator Johnston from Committee on Energy and Natural Resources filed written report. Report No. 102-480. Additional and minority views filed.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 102-543.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: A bill to establish the Keweenaw National Historical Park, and for other purposes.
short_title: Keweenaw National Historical Park Establishment Act

summary.text: Establishes the Keweenaw National Historical Park, as a unit of the National Park System, in and near Calumet and Hancock, Michigan. Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to acquire: (1) lands, or interests therein, within the boundaries of the park (such lands) by donation, purchase with donated or appropriated funds, exchange, or transfer; and (2) property owned by the State of Michigan or any political subdivision of the State only by donation. Prohibits: (1) such lands from being acquired without the consent of the owner unless the Secretary determines that the land is being developed, or is proposed to be developed, in a manner which is detrimental to the natural, scenic, historic, and other values for which the park is established; and (2) the Secretary from acquiring any lands pursuant to this Act if such lands have become contaminated with hazardous substances. Provides for cooperation by Federal agencies conducting or supporting activities directly affecting the park, subject to specified requirements. Requires the Secretary, within three fiscal years, to prepare and submit to the Congress a general management plan for the park. Authorizes the Secretary to: (1) enter into cooperative agreements with owners of property within the park of nationally significant historic or other cultural resources to provide for interpretive exhibits or programs; and (2) provide to any such owner financial and technical assistance to mark, interpret, and restore non-Federal properties within the park as the Secretary determines appropriate, subject to specified requirements. Directs that funds authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary for purposes of such financial and technical assistance be expended in the ratio of one dollar of Federal funds for each four dollar of funds contributed by non-Federal sources. Authorizes the Secretary to accept funds from non-Federal sources. Permits donations of land, or interests in land, by the State to be considered as a contribution from non-Federal sources for such purposes. Establishes the Keweenaw National Historical Park Advisory Commission. Sets forth provisions regarding the duties, membership, and administration of the Commission. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: Keweenaw National Historical Park Establishment Act
A bill to establish the Keweenaw National Historical Park, and for other purposes.
